metadata.title: CVE-2020-12407 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Mozilla Developer Nicolas Silva found that when using WebRender, Firefox would under certain conditions leak arbitrary GPU memory to the visible screen. The leaked memory content was visible to the user, but not observable from web content. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 77.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12407` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
